name: Hyatt Carmel Highlands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Carmel Highlands Inn is our home resort with our Hyatt Timeshare program. It is Fabulous! Perched high on a cliff above the Pacific on the north end of Carmel, you would be hard pressed to find a more beautiful setting. The Lobby and Lounge areas are spectacular. The units are updated regularly and are lux! Whirlpool double sized baths, graninte counters throughout and a fully equipped kitchen in every unit. We enjoy the Pacific Rim restaurant for a special treat (pricey!) and the lounge area always had great live jazz on the weekends. This last visit we checked out the pool and firepits that surround the property. You are situated right down the road from Point Lobos and miles of hiking along those beaches. Carmel Mission is just up the road and is a must see. Carmel proper is full of great restaurants and lovely little shops and art gallerys. A must do and see if you are staying at the Highlands Inn.
reviews.title: Carmel Highlands Inn - Home, Sweet Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Oh and did I mention the wood burning fireplaces in the rooms? With wood delivered to your door? ...Fab!
reviews.title: Gorgeous view and wonderful restaurant, very peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel about 2-3 years ago (twice), when they had time-share promotions.
reviews.title: The view is the thing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: If you are looking for a romantic getaway or a family retreat. This one can be great choice. The ocean view from our room is simply awesome, the balcony overlooking the ocean is great and relaxing, and we also love the size of our room (1 bedroom condo) and the restaurant. The ocean view from the beautiful main restaurant will just make your breath away!
reviews.title: Beware if you have asthma allergy or bronchial problems!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, the location of the resort is a big far away from all the tourist attractions (e.g. Carmel and Cannery Row), which can be a good thing and a bad thing. Good - you get a very peaceful and forest-like setting to relax (lots of wood-burning fireplace smells), if you love mother nature that is. The Bad - for younger children, they might be bored, except that they do have a nice swimming pool, but it's NOT heated (at least when we visited it). Overall, we had a great stay here.
reviews.title: Elegant beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a superb place to stay when you want to pamper yourself. The rooms are exquisitely appointed with leather chairs and sofa, fireplaces ready to light, lights with dimmers, kitchenette, and a large patio with table and chairs overlooking a spectacular view of the ocean. The suites/rooms are divided (and "undivided") simply by sliding wooden walls to open and close the spaces (living area, bedroom, and bath).
reviews.title: Wow! What a place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We happened to have a room with an oversized Jacuzzi tub which was too big for me to sit in without slipping into the water. I also turned the jets on too soon (when there was about an inch of water above them), thereby flooding a bathroom wall and much of the floor, so our towels were used long before we really needed them. The jets worked properly when the water reached about 3 inches above them.
reviews.title: Tranquility and Beauty in Carmel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is beautifully landscaped, with walkways throughout the "campus", and the rooms are scattered about in separate "condo-like" two-story buildings. Some rooms are near the pool, others are a short distance away. Our room was close to the main building, with a small outdoor Jacuzzi nearby, which is a nice accommodation for those not near the pool.
reviews.title: Pleasantly OVERWHELMED!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants on the property all serve fabulous food, ranging from simple hamburgers to classier "chef driven" dishes. The views of the ocean from the restaurants are breathtaking.
reviews.title: Gorgeous views, fabulous bar and restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If there's one downside it's the layout of the grounds if you happen to have trouble walking. The hotel handles that with very quick "golf cart" service: you'll have someone near your door within a minute or two. Unfortunately, the carts are too large for some of the passages. I'd hurt my knee and was walking with a cane, so getting around wasn't as easy as I'd have liked. But even that couldn't dampen the pleasure of staying here. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Peaceful ocean view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in their oceanview suite for three days. The view from the suite was gorgeous and I loved their huge jacuzzi tub. The staff service generally nice, but I wasn't too impressed with the restaurants (the food was super salty and the servers/waiters kept ignoring us), and their interior could use some updating (old wooden decoration, smelly couches, etc.).
reviews.title: gorgeous view but could use some improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was absolutely wonderful. The rooms were excellent and the wood burning fireplace made it warm and cozy. The restaurants at the hotel were OK. We we not overly pleased with the main restaurant, our food was not prepared well, and for a while we appeared to be "lost" to the server(they forgot about us!). I would not waste my money there but rather eat at one of the many outstanding places in downtown Carmel. I found the staff to be fine, outgoing, respectful,
reviews.title: Great get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: and prompt. I would do it again.
reviews.title: Property nice, service poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel, but unfortunately the service is poor. The staff we interacted with seemed to have a bit of an attitude and this really put us off the property. Management needs to fix this - the staff are there to take care of guests, not to be snooty. Lose the attitude and we would go back.
reviews.title: Gem of a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here 3 nights in a suite. It had a really nice small kitchen with everything, a wood burning fireplace which was re stocked everyday with a cleaning. The tub was amazing and really fit 2 people side by side and the views were stunning. It was near all of the great things to see in the area...North of Big Sur, South of Monterey, close to 17 mile drive...nestled on the hill it felt very private, quiet and like a little second home
reviews.title: Awesome views, romantic nights!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, this is a review of the Hyatt Vacation Club portion of the resort. These are also part of the Interval International inventory and they do have an attached hotel for non owners.
reviews.title: Superb location, elegant resort, nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn has very classy grounds, with mountain stream/waterfalls, several hot tubs nestled amongst the trees, and even an outdoor fire area. The rooms had jacuzzi tubs and a fire place, where housekeeping built a ready to light fire every day.
reviews.title: great for Big Sur and Carmel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: The ocean views are stunning, when the fog isn't heavy. It has a very distinct moutain resort setting, but is not too far from Carmel downtown area -- about a 15 minute drive.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we did not eat there, it does have a higher end restaurant with stunning views of the coast. There is a great room in the main building with a nice lodge ambience. There is a modest fitness center with nice equipment.
reviews.title: Condo presentation worth every second!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice views and service

description: 448 room luxury resort nestled in Monterey pines overlooking Point Lobos State Reserve. Oceanview rooms include wood burning fireplaces and private balconies and 11 suites also include in-room double spa baths, kitchenettes. Renowned Pacific's Edge Restaurant(dinner only) and California Market Restaurant (breakfast & lunch).
